runs.comm: full, just outside off, 127ks, right in the slot, and Mukhtar swings and misses. Nowhere near the ball
on a length, on off, pushed with soft hands towards mid-off and steals a single. No clean pick-up from Mathews as he tried to underarm a throw at the stumps
pushes at a length ball, gets a single off the inside half
wide down the leg side, only 124ks, and this is no slower ball. he is a little slow for a man his height. Hasn't tried a short ball yet
and another wide down the leg side. Bowled at 127ks this time. Malinga looking to encourage Fernando
fullish, on the pads, flicked away to deep midwicket
slower ball, 107ks, half-volley outside off, pushed wide of mid-off for one
another slower ball, but the batsman should be disappointed he has actually missed out on a half-volley pitched outside leg. Is hit on the pad
yet another wide down the leg side. This time short of a length, and going down with the angle
walks down the wicket, gets inside the line of a length ball, and clips it to deep square leg
short of a length, outside off, pushed to point
wristly flick to a length ball angling in, falls just short of short midwicket
short of a length, going down leg, and Mukhtar misses out. Gets just the leg-bye
down the wicket, Mathews follows him and cramps him for room. Shehzad gets just the single to short fine leg

Mathews strikes already. Mukhtar has been denied any room, and he has been itching to make room. with this ball too he is looking to back away. Mathews stays tight, bowls short of a length and around off. In the end, out of position, Mukhtar tries to whip it to leg, and gets a thick outside edge to short third man
slight shape back in from a length outside off. Beats the inside edge. pace: 123ks
length ball, slower ball, 112ks, on the pads, picked away for a couple
short of a length, outside off, looks to cut it, gets a bottom edge towards short cover
makes room to punched a shortish straight ball to third man for a single
walks down at him first ball, Fernando bowls just short of a length with no room. Defended to short cover
a slower ball, pretty straight, on a length, and a defensive response to end the over
shimmies down, Mathews doesn't budge from his line just outside off. Defended back to him
angling in, Hafeez plays across its line, gets an inside edge to short fine leg for one
there, Jaundy, you have the first. Shehzad clears his front leg and drives this length ball on the up. Between the bowler and mid-on it goes
on a length, outside off, Shehzad opens the face to get a single to third man
length ball outside off, gentle pace, gets the room, and drives it over cover. Dismissed out of his sight
down the wicket, makes room too, Mathews follows him, cramps him up, but Hafeez still manages to clear cover with an inside-out chip
Shehzad backs away to make room, Malinga follows him and hits his pad

lovely shot. Shehzad sets up his base with a slight movement of the back foot towards the off stump. Gets a short ball over middle and off, and arches back to make room, and cuts it between point and cover-point
Shehzad is backing away for room again, Malinga follows him with a really full ball, and concedes four off the inside edge. Fine leg is up in the circle
short, just outside off, Shehzad looks to use his pace and open the face of the bat, but is beaten by the extra bounce
Malinga gets away with this one. This is short, at 137ks, and has sit up to be hit. Hit Shehzad does, but straight to midwicket
making room again, Malinga bowls a yorker at the toes, Shehzad plays a mini helicopter shot, gets a single off the inside edge
slower offcutter, into the pads, clipped away towards deep square. Not hit hard, and the outfield is slow, so they risk the second and make it
he is down the wicket and away from the stumps, Mathews denies him any room, but they take a single with a bunt towards cover-point
he shows him the ramp early, Mathews bowls fu8ll and wide, trying to defeat him there, but Hafeez reaches it and ramps it over short fine leg
short, sharp, at 135ks, gets it over the shoulder. Hafeez is on the front foot as he tries to hook, and is beaten on the top edge
slower ball, on a length, just outside off, pushed firmly towards mid-off. Won't get a single
short of a length, at off, opens the face, but can't beat point
begins with a long hop, and is lucky it has gone only for two to cow corner
offbreak second ball. Oh that's his mystery ball. From the front of the band with a legspinner's action. But easy to pick from behind. Shehzad doesn't, though, for now, but keeps it out
another long hop, and just a single off the pull. Lucky so far
tossed up on the pads, worked to leg for one
a half-volley outside off, driven to deep cover
short again, no turn, pulled away for one
starts with the slower ball that he bowls from deep inside the fingers. It is difficult to pick. But it is wide and on a length, and Hafeez manages to slice it over point
makes room very early. Perera bowls a slower ball just outside off. Shehzad opens the face, gets a single to short third man. This is a legcutter

a long hop gets a wicket. Perera bowls a slower legcutter, but this is short and Hafeez has picked it early. He goes for the pull, but it is one of those days when you hit it out of the crews and straight to the man at deep midwicket. How Hafeez will he hoping he had mistimed this
short of a length, tucked away off the hip
short, outside off, pulled to deep midwicket, but along the ground
short of a length, wide. This is not too short, but Malik has launched into this one. Like a rocket this races away for four square on the off side
legbreak, half-volley on off, driven to deep cover

quicker nonturner. It skids on after pitching short of a length. Malik gets a soft inside edge. The ball reaches around the 30-yard circle towards square leg with the fielders in the deep. They take two
flighted on the pads, worked away for one
and not for the first time Dilshan has lost his boot. This time it costs Sri Lanka one run. Shehzad pushes this to the right of short cover, and the boot slows Dilshan down. They take a second
that quick delivery again - a bit like what Piyush Chawla bowls - goes for a leg-bye
tossed up outside off, driven to long-on for one
slower ball, full on the pads, driven to long-on for one
superbly bowled. Shehzad backs away to make room, and Perera slips in a slower ball just inside the tram line. Shehzad is not happy that this is not called a wide, but it is a legitimate delivery
regulation pace for a change. On a length and outside off, and beats Shehzad's attempt at a big drive
full and straight, squeezed out for a single into the off side
walks down the wicket to work this from outside off to square leg to get a single

it looks like a beautiful shot, but he is nearly gone. Or is he gone? We are going to check the catch taken at wide long-off. Soft signal is not out. And rightly so. At any rate it is a great effort from Mathews. When Shehzad hits this inside-out it looks like he is getting a six over extra cover, but the slower ball means he has not timed it as well as he looks. So Mathews runs hard from his station at long-off, and incredibly reaches it. However, the ball just about kisses the turf before settling in his hands as he dives
down the wicket, the bowler follows him with a flat legbreak, and he pads it away
down the wicket, meets it at the half-volley, but hits it right back at the bowler. Gets a single off the misfield
full, just outside off, driven to long-off
down the wicket, takes this legbreak on the full, places it wide of long-on for two
this is that quicker delivery, Shehzad is down the wicket, and hits it to long-on. It has gone only slightly wide of the man, and Malik converts this one into two
too full, on the pads, hit to long-on along the ground
looks for the ramp, shuffles well across, but just can't get the timing right to a slower ball. Beaten outside off
this slower legcutter is too short and sits up. Shehzad pulls this between long-on and deep midwicket. That should ease some of Shehzad's edginess

oh he has ramped him straight to short fine leg. He shuffles across, meets this on the full, and times it pretty much off the middle of the bat, but the fact that he is dragging it from well outside off means he has not got the distance he wants. Malinga takes a head-high catch at short fine leg
short of a length, pushed straight to pint, and Akmal sends Malik back although it is the non-striker's call
full and straight, driven to long-on
slower legcutter, on a length, on the pads, worked around the corner for one
driven to long-off for one
that quicker one, hits him on the pad, but is headed down leg
tossed up, full toss, flicked away to leg
down the wicket, yorks himself, gets a single to long-on

short of a length, no room, can't beat point with the late cut. U Akmal again responds late to the call from the non-striker. Vandersay makes a mess of the throw, and is hit in the box. Oh hang on. Bowlers don't wear boxes. Not sure why Mathews is finding it funny
down the wicket, too close to the pitch of the ball, gets just the single. And on debut, the legspinner has considered zero boundaries in his allotment of four overs
lovely timing from Malik. A length ball slightly too straight, and Malik has beaten deep square leg to his right. The man has hardly much ground to make, but the ball keeps getting away from him
pushed straight to the man inside the circle on the leg side, but Malik is exceptionally quick and beats the direct hit
bouncer, too high, and an easy call for the umpire to call it a wide
slower ball, too short, and despite the lack of bounce he has pulled this between deep square and deep midwicket. Comes back for the second
big big wide outside off. Malinga is not having a good night
wide half-volley, driven away with an open face for a single
yorker/low full toss, pushed to long-on for one
on a length, on off, and Akmal has driven this right back over Malinga's head for four. That's 2-0-24-0 for Malinga. Not looking good. No pace, no yorkers, no movement
shuffles right across, Mathews bowls a nice outswinger just outside off. Malik looks to work it to leg, gets a soft outside edge to short third man
down the wicket, Mathews bowls short, and even though Akmal is cramped he manages to pull it wide of long-on for two
and Mathews bowls a wide down the leg side
full and straight, driven down the ground, to the left of long-on, but they get just the single
full and straight again, can't get under it, just takes the single to long-on
short ball, hurries on to him, is higher than the shoulder too. Akmal top-edges it towards deep midwicket for one

full, on the pads, Malik looks to bludgeon it over midwicket,. and gets a thick outside edge that is placed perfectly between point and short third man. With this crafty shot, Malik reaches 1000 T20I runs
starts with a slower short ball, pulled away for one
oh he is really lucky. This is right in the slot. On a length, outside off, gentle pace. Batsmen in T20 hit it anywhere they want, but Malik has just swung outside its line
bouncer, too high, called a wide. Easy call again
slower short ball, Malik doesn't pick it, but manages to oull it to deep midwicket. Vithagane misfields it, and concedes the second
makes room, gets under a full ball outside off, but gets just the single to deep point
and if you bowl at this pace with noo real accuracy or movement, sooner or later you will be sorted out. Fernando bowls short, in mid-120s, and Akmal hooks it for six over square leg

and length at gentle pace again. That's the stuff T20 batsmen's dreams are made of. When they talk to T20 gods, they ask for balls at a length and bowled at under 130ks. And then they slog them over wide long-on for sixes. As Akmal has now
full and wide, just inside the tram line. Well bowled for a dot
yorker gone slightly wrong with a low full toss, but they get just the single to long-on. That's the advantage of the yorker. If it goes slightly wrong, it is still hard to get under

lovely shot. Nice little touch from Akmal. Malinga looks for a wide yorker, but he bowls a slightly high full toss. Akmal waits for it, and then opens the face to place it between point and short third man
Akmal is surprised. He is not expecting a regulation pace short ball with the third man inside the cirlce. Malinga bowls it, and Akmal has no response for it
looks like the slower yorker with Akmal walking across the stumps, but he gets the bat down on it, and the bottom edge towards deep midwicket gets him a couple
that's a poor delivery. The third man has gone back, the mid-off has come up, and Malinga has bowled a wide length ball. Akmal gets room to swing his arms, and he drives it over point for four
backs away early, shuffles back to outside off by the time Perera releases the ball. Flicks the full toss square of deep midwicket for a couple
low full toss, on off stump, regulation pace, and Malik goes over mid-off, who is in the circle. Malik is down on a knee to make sure he gets under it, and he manages to do so
another low full toss, but a touch straighter than previous ball, and Malik slogs this to deep midwicket for one
tries the yorker, but bowls a full ball, which Akmal inside-edges into his pad. The ball ricochets back to Perera for a dot
yorker this time, outside off, dug out for a single to cover
waist-high full toss, and Malik has hit this straight to deep square leg for just the single
shuffles across to take this full ball from outside off and place it wide of long-on for a couple
low full toss outside off, driven to deep cover for one
shuffles across, Malinga looks for a straight yorker. Bowls the low full toss on the pads, worked away for a couple square on the leg side
gets the yorker right this time. Dug out back to him

half-volley from Malinga. He is now one blow from his fifty, and he has one ball to go. Malinga clearly out of form. He is trying the yorkers, but they are not coming out right. And Akmal lofts this over long-off for his third six. He, too, is one blow from his fifty

Malinga won't get the fifty. Nor will Akmal. That's a Malinga special. Rare one, but we get one today. Akmal is right in front of the stumps to set a strong back-foot base, Malinga bowls a yorker that is slightly off pace. It squeezes under the bat, which comes down on the right line, but slightly early. Hits him on the back foot and dead in front

bowls a wide full toss, Malik drives it straight of deep cover where D de Silva makes a diving save and keeps the ball in. Malik runs for the third, he is not in the crease, but Fernando just collects the throw and walks back to his mark oblivious of the run-out opportunity
not only does he miss out on a juicy wide full toss, he is expecting a wide call and has not run a bye
that's one wide full toss too many. This has come right out of the crews, and Afridi has sent this over long-off for a six

another low full toss, but this time he hasn't timed it and has hit it towards long-on. Malik looks like he has sacrificed his wicket going for the second, but the umpire Ranmore Martinesz doesn't even go to the third umpire. He clearly wants Malik to run more
first wicket for Fernando in international cricket. Slower length ball that hits top of off with vigorous activity of Afridi moving across and trying to scoop it over short fine all around it

full toss outside off, slightly off pace, and he is beaten. Shocking that Malik doesn;t try to run the bye off the last ball of the innings. Shocking when any batsman doesn't run that extra run off the last ball of the innings. You never know what you might get
